item.title: Some Thoughts on an Aggregator for Library Science Articles
item.description:
As I go through various Library Science issues related OLAC and language documentation deposit descriptions, I have begun to wonder if there is any aggregator for Library Science Journals and their content. If there were such an aggregator what might the facets be? Here is a partial list:

  • Serials
  • Monographs
  • Maps (cartography)
  • ETDs (Thesis and Dissertation Collections)
  • Software
  • Video Games
  • Collections
  • Aggregates
  • Video
  • Images
  • Audio
  • Copyright
  • Cataloging Standards (Practices)
  • Metadata Standards
  • Digitization
  • Portals (IU/UX)
  • Scholarly Communications
  • Learning Resources (any thing could be a LR, but I specifically mean things designed as curriculum)

Note: I did not put “cultural heritage” or “indigenous materials” on the list as everything could be these — it depends on the perspective. I am looking for the broad areas of practice that librarians deal with.

So far here is my list of Library Science Journals from which I have read articles:

  • Library Hi Tech
  • The Electronic Library
  • International Information & Library Review
  • International Journal on Digital Libraries
  • International Journal of Digital Curation
  • Library Philosophy and Practice
  • Library Resources & Technical Services
  • LIBER Quarterly: The Journal of the Association of European Research Libraries
  • Law Library Journal
  • Library Review
  • Cataloging & Classification Quarterly
  • Evidence Based Library and Information Practice
  • The Journal of Academic Librarianship
  • Information Technology and Libraries
  • The Serials Librarian
  • Journal of Documentation
  • Journal of Web Librarianship
  • Journal of Library Metadata
  • Journal of Internet Cataloging
  • Australian Academic & Research Libraries
  • Reference Services Review
  • Information and Learning Science
  • Curator: The Museum Journal
  • Learned Publishing
  • School of Information Student Research Journal
  • Archival Science
  • The Code4Lib Journal
  • D-Lib Magazine
  • International Journal of Metadata, Semantics and Ontologies
  • Ariadne
  • New Library World
  • American Libraries
  • Bulletin of the Association for Information Science and Technology

Of course there are more in MIAR:

  • http://miar.ub.edu/lista/TITOL/Library (143)
  • http://miar.ub.edu/lista/TITOL/archival (6)
  • http://miar.ub.edu/lista/TITOL/Information%20science (49)

item.title: Kainji Bibliography
item.description:
About authors in the Biblography

Rebecca Paterson

Stuart John McGill

Clark D. Regnier

Clement Tuko

John Bendor-Samuel

Roger M. Blench

Stephen Dettweiler

Sonia Dettweiler

P. G. Harris

David Heath

Carleen Heath

Hugh Paterson III

Major sources of resources include

McGill’s SOAS deposit Blench’s manuscripts Paterson’s Data Trove Detweiler’s content Undigitized content at the Paterson house.

Resources about how the Biblography is managed

A spreadsheet looking at major aggregation platforms: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rDTthGvUkmC5UrRyNoVrE1QIEeA0BZjJ7n3F49I3I4U/edit?usp=sharing

A document describing how we are approaching the annotated Bibliography. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1whZPFPZ4lAg7GigHdfGo2e-Qnz47wDPYZUYuMrxfyLI/edit?usp=sharing
